message_1:
Consider the temporal logic formula F[2, 5]p, where p is a proposition that can be true or false at any given moment. 
What would be the truth value of this formula at time 3 with the following interpretation?
p = true at time 1 and p = false at time 4.
message_2:
The temporal logic formula F[2, 5]p means that the proposition p will be true at some point in the time interval [2, 5].

Given the interpretation that p = true at time 1 and p = false at time 4, we can analyze the truth value of the formula at time 3.

Since p is true at time 1, which is outside the interval [2, 5], it does not affect the truth value of F[2, 5]p at time 3. However, p is false at time 4, which is within the interval [2, 5]. Since there is no other information about the truth value of p within the interval [2, 5], we cannot conclude that p will be true at any point in this interval.

Therefore, the truth value of the formula F[2, 5]p at time 3 is false.
